definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: The neutral mask provoked little reaction.
sentences.chinese: 戴中立派面具的人则没有引发任何过激反应。

sentences.english: But if our measures are too extreme, that could also cause problems.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果措施太过激，这同样可能造成问题。

sentences.english: Of course, there are those within the Democratic Party who tend toward similar zealotry .
sentences.chinese: 当然，在民主党内也有人趋向于类似的党派过激行为。

sentences.english: We do not agree to individual overreactions.
sentences.chinese: 对于个别过激行为，我们不赞成。

sentences.english: Steroids might also cause aggressive, dangerous behavior, as suggested by the murder-suicide of Chris Benoit.
sentences.chinese: 合成类固醇同样会导致行为过激甚至是自杀。

sentences.english: All this is fiery radical writing.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都走火辣辣的过激之作。

sentences.english: Always a moderate, he deprecated extremists of both sections.
sentences.chinese: 他一向稳健，反对双方的过激派。

sentences.english: You could overreact to emotional situations regarding your relationship.
sentences.chinese: 对于你恋情中的情感问题，你可能会反应过激。

sentences.english: Thepurpose of the next revolution, he predicts, will be to undo theexcesses of the last.
sentences.chinese: 他预言道，下次革命的目的将是撤销最后的过激行为。

sentences.english: She tends to over-react when things go wrong .
sentences.chinese: 事情一有差错她往往反应过激。

definition: to overstep the bounds of what is proper/to take sth too far/(of a measuring device) to go off the scale
words and actions/what one says and what one does
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to let emotions affect one's decisions
to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
